Property.name: gidx_ignore
Property.HelpText: Forces the game to ignore the Global Index value for textures, which fixes some texture issues at the cost of some memory.

Property.name: backface_cull
Property.HelpText: Restores a standard technique called 'back-face culling,' where the back-side of models are made invisible. This was lost in the GameCube port, and has caused many issues since. Required for many fixes.

Property.name: backcolor
Property.HelpText: The Dreamcast supported drawing a gradient color as the background, but HD broke this feature so usually just draws black. This fixes the bug, and restores the original Dreamcast gradient back-color.

Property.name: ptcl_scl
Property.HelpText: Locks the polygon-particle's scale to the game world instead of screen resolution, and fixes the sprite-particle's scale being halved since Dreamcast.

Property.name: sprite
Property.HelpText: Fixes many sprite positioning errors by changing the calculation used to move the sprite closer to the camera.

Property.name: model_tint
Property.HelpText: Fixes a dark tint some models incorrectly have due to unset diffuse values. 'Match Dreamcast' leaves some models tinted to match the Dreamcast version. (Note: They may still not look correct due to missing specular!)

Property.name: screen_tint
Property.HelpText: Changes shader values inside obj.pak to remove the slight bright tint applied to the screen, likely a accidental leftover from the Xbox 360 version. 'Keep tint' restores the vanilla values.

Property.name: spotlite
Property.HelpText: Fixes many spot lights, such as the Egg Walker's flashlight, by replacing a, commonly used, vertex shader that incorrectly treats them as directional lights.

Property.name: env_flip
Property.HelpText: Flips environment map textures (shiny effect) horizontally to match the Dreamcast version.

Property.name: cheap_shadow
Property.HelpText: Modifier shadows use model volumes for shading, the same system used in the Dreamcast version. This setting only enables drawing. 'Performance' reduces the number of draw calls at the cost of accuracy.

Property.name: mode_gl
Property.HelpText: Which shadow type should be used globally (excluding player characters). 'Modifier' is the Dreamcast shadow system.

Property.name: mode_pl
Property.HelpText: Which shadow type is cast by the player character.

Property.name: resolution
Property.HelpText: Changes the resolution of the shadow texture used, higher values lead to less pixelated shadows at the cost of memory and performance - lower values the opposite.

Property.name: opacity_gl
Property.HelpText: Changes the darkness/opacity of the shadows outside of Chao World. The GameCube's opacity is only an aproximation.

Property.name: opacity_ch
Property.HelpText: Changes the darkness/opacity of the shadows in Chao World. The Dreamcast version used lighter shadows for Chao World.

Property.name: e_jet
Property.HelpText: Restores the blue jet effect used on many enemies that was removed in the GameCube version.

Property.name: e_emblem
Property.HelpText: Fixes the draw order of GUN enemies so their emblems render correctly.

Property.name: e_ai_shield
Property.HelpText: Restores the Dreamcast's version of the Hunter's Shield, which looks noticeable less broken.

Property.name: e_stg_tex
Property.HelpText: Restores enemy textures that were specific to some stages in the Dreamcast version.

Property.name: e_chaos_trans
Property.HelpText: Restores Artificial Chaos Transparency effects from Dreamcast. NOTE: Requires Back-Face Culling.

Property.name: balloon_trans
Property.HelpText: Restores Item Balloon Transparency effects from Dreamcast. NOTE: Requires Back-Face Culling.

Property.name: goalring_trans
Property.HelpText: Restores Goal Ring Transparency effects from Dreamcast. NOTE: Requires Back-Face Culling.

Property.name: udreel
Property.HelpText: Fixes the rendering of the Up Down Reel (player pully), including the Dreamcast flashing effect.

Property.name: itembox
Property.HelpText: Fixes the rendering of the Item-Box, specifically where the bubble/glass would always draw over the item instead of around it. NOTE: Requires Back-Face Culling.

Property.name: jo_tree
Property.HelpText: Fixes the tree model that lost its shadow and all of it's vertex colors in the HD version.

Property.name: e_explosion
Property.HelpText: Forces explosions to use the sorted display layer.

Property.name: mizugomi
Property.HelpText: Restores the floating water particles from the Dreamcast version.

Property.name: dc_ring
Property.HelpText: Restores the Dreamcast version's black ring shadows.

Property.name: fade_fix
Property.HelpText: Fixes element fade issues when in a wider aspect ratio than native 4:3.

Property.name: map_stretch
Property.HelpText: Fixes the last section of the Stage Select menu stretching due to the larger aspect ratio by implementing the same fix as the Xbox 360 version.

Property.name: map_textbar
Property.HelpText: Restores the blue text bar in the Stage Select menu from the Dreamcast version.

Property.name: fadein
Property.HelpText: Restores the fade in effect that was removed in the GameCube version.

Property.name: sparkle
Property.HelpText: Fixes the particles always rendering behind the emblem.

Property.name: water_fog
Property.HelpText: Fixes the draw order of the water and fog surfaces.

Property.name: lightmod
Property.HelpText: Restores the objects that effect character lighting that were turned off in the GameCube version.

Property.name: murky
Property.HelpText: Restores the murky water effect that was massively toned down in the GameCube version.

Property.name: pitfall
Property.HelpText: Restores a large pit in Rouge's section that was replaced with an ugly black plane in the GameCube version.

Property.name: glowpulse
Property.HelpText: Restores the pulsating glow effect on King Boom Boo from the Dreamcast version.

Property.name: lights
Property.HelpText: Restores the less-beta lighting parameters from the Dreamcast version.

Property.name: sundoors
Property.HelpText: Restores the sundoors to how they looked in the Dreamcast version.

Property.name: kanban
Property.HelpText: Restores the roadside posters from the Dreamcast and GameCube versions.

Property.name: seafix
Property.HelpText: Disables fog on the sea model to fix a harsh cut off, and to match the Dreamcast version.

Property.name: disp_replace
Property.HelpText: Render Fix completely replaces how the Events are drawn allowing for more graphical fixes, such as upgrades drawing above effects.

Property.name: draw_equip
Property.HelpText: Whether player upgrades should draw during events or not. NOTE: Requires Enhanced Displayer.

Property.name: draw_mod
Property.HelpText: Draw shadow modifiers from the Dreamcast version. NOTE: Requires Enhanced Displayer to draw correctly.

Property.name: texanim
Property.HelpText: Rewrites the conversion code to fix a bug that caused only one texture animated model to work per event.

Property.name: enforce_43
Property.HelpText: All events are forced into 4:3 mode, which hides many errors the developers never thought would be seen.

Property.name: shd_opacity_sw
Property.display: Change Shadow Map Opacity in Chao World
Property.HelpText: An experimental feature that allows the vanilla shadow maps to change opacity while in Chao World, to match the Dreamcast modifier shadows.

Property.name: miles_tail_mod
Property.HelpText: An experimental feature that adds modifier shadows for Tails' Tails. This will likely be further worked on so the shadows better match the tails' animations.

Property.name: objpak_write
Property.HelpText: Allow writing to the obj.pak file. It's very unlikely this feature will need to be disabled, however the option is here if needed.

Property.name: env_fix
Property.HelpText: Fixes a PC only, broken draw function that breakes environment maps (shiny effect).

Property.name: jmp_aura
Property.HelpText: Forces Sonic and Shadow's jump auras to be double sided.

Property.name: bfc_event
Property.HelpText: Disables back-face culling in events/cutscenes.

Property.name: chaos0tex
Property.HelpText: Overrides the texture animation system Chaos 0 uses to allow the use of custom models, if this is off the game will otherwise crash.

Property.name: dcshadpatch
Property.HelpText: King Boom Boo's fight crashes with DC Shadows enabled, this patches the small code oversight. Unlikely to cause issues, but is here if it does.
